results.title: A Piece of cake = Cest pas chinois
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gilles Gascon, Pierre Heberrt and Jacques Bobet
results.brief_description: The effortless style of the champion gymnast seems a piece of cake. Made without commentary, this film begins with eager young people going through their exercises in a school gymnasium and concludes with an exhibition of faultless gymnastics at the 1973 China-Canada competitions.

results.title: A Picture for Harold's room
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Adapted from the book written and illustrated by Crockett Johnson, this animated story tells about a little boy, Harold, who uses a purple crayon to create various adventures in which he alone participates.

results.title: A Phoenix rising
results.brief_description: A documentary film showing how the community of Mt. Macedon is piecing together its life again after being annihilated by the fires of Ash Wednesday. The film is based on interviews with some of the residents and gives case studies of a couple of families. Written and narrated by John Bonney.

results.title: A Phantasy
results.brief_description: A surrealist abstract art film with pastel drawings and cut-out animation by Norman McLaren and music for saxophone and synthetic sound by Maurice Blackburn. In a dream-like landscape, inanimate but familiar objects come to life to disport themselves in grave dances and playful rituals. Music by Maurice Blackburn. (Awards: Venice, Toronto, Boston)

results.title: A Personal search
results.brief_description: In this autobiographical documentary, John Whitney, one of the best-known film and computer artists of our time, reflects on and explores his lifelong search for the complentarity of music and visual art, and the synthesis of film and computer technologies. In doing so, he describes current developments that foretell radical and exciting new ways viewers will soon be experiencing music and art.

results.title: A Personal matter
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Keith Gow, Australian Council for Union Training and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Representative”.
A migrant worker in a factory needs time off to take his sick wife to hospital, but the union representative does not see this as a sufficiently important matter for him to deal with. Raises the question of prejudices and principles of justice and fair play in relation to the union’s responsibility to the individual worker.

results.title: A Personal history of the Australian surf: being the confessions of a straight poofter
results.creator_credit: Adams Packer Films, Phillip Adams, Jeremy Cornford, John B Murray and Michael Blakemore
results.brief_description: Australian theatre and film director, Michael Blakemore, recreates his childhood and adolescence in the 1930s and 1940s in Sydney and reflects on the events which led to his career in the theatre and eventually a directorship of Britain’s National Theatre. By implication the film is also something of a mini history of surfing in Australia. Utilising a compilation of old newsreels, family snapshots, re-enactments and Blakemore’s commentary, the film is an intriguing piece of Australian social history.
results.title_for_label: A Personal history of the Australian surf: being the confessions of a straight poofter

results.title: A Perfectly normal day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time Management”.
Professor Cake in PhD, Harvard show that a typical work day is filled with interruptions and crisis and goes about showing you how to mange. Some very good advice. Turns a crisis into an opportunity.

results.title: A Perfect world
results.creator_credit: Mark Johnson, Warner Bros Pictures and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Eight year old Phillip, the son of a devout Jehovah’s witness mother, is staying home while all other children are out trick-or-treating. The next morning their home is broken into by prison escapee Butch Haynes, who needing a hostage to aid his escape from jail, grabs Phillip and flees. Phillip curiously looks up to Butch and willingly accompanies him as they take to Texas highway on the run from the cops. Butch is not particularly anxious to make it to the Texas border, being more concerned about fulfilling Phillip’s prohibited wants and dreams. Texas Ranger Red Garnett is not in any hurry to catch Butch either. As Butch and Phillip form a father-son relationship, the paths of Butch and Garnett gradually come together in time for a final confrontation. Cast includes Kevin Costner, Clint Eastwood, Laura Dern and T.J. Lowther.
